pr_title: [squeezebox] Implement like/unlike for remote streaming services

timeline.message:
Implement like/unlike for remote streaming services

Signed-off-by: Mark Hilbush <mark@hilbush.com>

timeline.bodyText: Do you really need to add another author tag each time?
timeline.author: cpmeister
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -68,6 +68,7 @@
  * @author Patrik Gfeller - Timeout for TTS messages increased from 30 to 90s.
  * @author Mark Hilbush - Get favorites from server and play favorite
  * @author Mark Hilbush - Convert sound notification volume from channel to config parameter
+ * @author Mark Hilbush - Add like/unlike functionality

replies.bodyText: No. I typically do it only for changes of some significance.
replies.author: mhilbush

timeline.bodyText: So the command param isn't used? Shouldn't you confirm that the ON command was sent?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I thought about that, and I probably should check for ON. OTOH, I was trying to be flexible in allowing any command to trigger the operation. I'll add the check.
replies.author: mhilbush

timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Sure. I forgot you can do that.
replies.author: mhilbush

timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: I had actually tried to do it this way initially. Because the requestFavorites method is in SqueezeBoxServerHandler, not the inner class SqueezeServerListener it generates a compiler error. Is there a better way to handle this?
replies.author: mhilbush
cpmeister

timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister
cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Yeah. Wish I had thought of that. 😉
replies.author: mhilbush

timeline.bodyText: You should cancel the future this produces in case this handler gets disposed.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Ok, done. The isDone may not be necessary, but I added it for completeness.
replies.author: mhilbush

timeline.bodyText: You should specify the charset used here.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Ok. Done. BTW there are quite a few places in the code base that don't specify the charset.
replies.author: mhilbush
